column4: How do I identify my nick on this channel? I can't figure it out and it keeps blocking me from talking
For the moment

Hmm. Seems to be taking its time in blocking me this time. Anyway, I'm trying to dual boot Ubuntu and Windows 7. I created the partitions for Ubuntu and installed it, but now neither will load. It just says"
non-system disk or disk error replace and strike any key when ready
i had the same issue with my tri-boot....was a bootloader issue
you can change that in the BIOPS or hitting the boot menu
you might be able to modify the partitions through GParted ( or whatever ) and make another partition bootable though
there isnt XChat already installed? apps>internet>XChat IRC
I'm on Windows 7 at the moment, not Ubuntu
thats the bootlaoder
To edit the linux partition to bootable do I right click the extended partition, click "flags" and check "boot"?
not sure i know there is a way to edit the start up options for GRUB though... yes that will make it bootable, not sure if the Loader will interfere or not
set it to bootable. Gonna see if it boots up now
have you tried running recover ( or whatever) from your install CD?
That seems to have made a difference. I now get "error: file not found"
then underneath it "grub rescue>" and a blinking cursor
i meant the linux distro you used to install
haven't tried that. Hold on a second
also try making that 1mb partion "not bootable   or " do not usse partition"\
is there a private chat function in the web client?
I'm back in Ubuntu. How do I run the "recover" thing?
